title: SignalDetectionTool: R Package for signal detection on infectious disease surveillance data
text: apply signal detection data recent 6 weeks first need preprocess linelist apply get_signals(). Inside get_signals() linelist aggregated timeseries containing weekly counts cases. apply different signal detection methods use parameter method. generate stratified signals use parameter stratification. Please look function documentation details. example signals generated using default paramters FarringtonFlexible stratification: generated signals output data.frame containing aggregated number cases per week additional columns cases_in_outbreak, alarms, upperbound, expected, category, stratum, method number_of_weeks. cases_in_outbreak generated column outbreak_status available provided linelist. counts many cases week already part known outbreak. alarms column booleans indicating weeks signal generated. course majority weeks aggregated timeseries contain NA column recent selected number_of_weeks filled TRUE FALSE. upperbound contains numeric threshold calculated signal detection methods. alarms majority weeks aggregated timeseries contain NA calculated number_of_weeks signals generated. Furthermore algorithms EARS calculate threshold. expected numeric value giving expected number cases signal detection algorithm. filled weeks signals generated. category Character string specifying stratum timeseries belongs added stratification parameters (details next example). unstratified timeseries NA. stratum Character string specifying category stratum timeseries belongs added stratification parameters (details next example). unstratified timeseries NA. method Character string specifying signal detection method used. number_of_weeks Integer specifying number weeks signals generated. Generating stratified signals using EARS: signals_ears_stratified output data frame long format, containing multiple time series weekly aggregated case counts. time series corresponds unique combination specified stratification variables, strata stacked vertically. columns category stratum identify individual timeseries. example obtain following values: * category filled column names provided stratification parameter. * stratum values variables. example obtain: * category filled “age_group” “county” * stratum contains “00–04”, “05–09”, “10–14”, “15–19”, “20–24”, “25–29”, “30–34”, “35–39”, “40–44”, “45–49”, “50–54”, “55–59”, “60–64”, “65–69”, “70–74”, “75–79”, “80–84”, “85–89”, “90–94”, “95–99”, “100–104”, “105–109” rows category == "age_group". rows category == "county" values stratum “Burgenland”, “Kärnten”, “Niederösterreich”, “Oberösterreich”, “Salzburg”, “Steiermark”, “Tirol”, “Vorarlberg”, “Wien”.
code: data_prepro <- input_example %>% preprocess_data() signals <- data_prepro %>% get_signals() data_prepro <- input_example %>% preprocess_data() signals_ears_stratified <- data_prepro %>% get_signals(   method = "ears",   stratification = c("age_group", "county") )

text: Specifies input data retrieved. Currently supports file based data sources box. - file (Scalar: Boolean) - TRUE → Use external file (CSV Excel). - FALSE → Use database. - filepath (Scalar: String) Path external file, applicable file: TRUE. - db (Nested Mapping) Child elements define database connection details (used file: FALSE). - host (Scalar: String) – Database server address (e.g., localhost). - port (Scalar: Integer) – Database port (e.g., 5432). - database (Scalar: String) – Name database. note true database support right now! DB related parameters merely placeholders moment. actually connect database tool, need define custom functions apply monkey patching. plan add full database support future.

previous_headings: Data Configuration File > Config File Structure > 1. Default Configuration (default)
title: Automated Signal Detection for Infectious Disease Surveillance
text: Defines key variables analysis signal detection. - pathogen (Scalar: String) – Default pathogen analysis (e.g., Pertussis). - strata (Sequence Scalars: List Strings) – Categories used stratify analysis (e.g., age_group, community). - signal_detection_period (Scalar: Integer) – Time period (weeks months) detecting signals. - signal_detection_algorithm (Scalar: String) – Method used signal detection (e.g., ears). - pandemic_correction: (Scalar: Boolean) Correct effects COVID-19 pandemic, used GLM algorithms - intervention_date: (Scalar: String, Date format YYYY-MM-DD) - Date intervention pandemic correction models

NULL single value estimated                     taking mean observations previous                     first range value. "glm" GLM form $$\log(m_t)                       = \alpha + \beta t + \sum_{s=1}^S (\gamma_s                       \sin(\omega_s t) + \delta_s \cos(\omega_s t)),$$                     \(\omega_s = \frac{2\pi}{52}s\)                     Fourier frequencies fitted. model                     used predict range values. trans one following transformations (warning: Anscombe NegBin transformations experimental) rossi standardized variables z3 proposed Rossi standard standardized variables z1 (based              asymptotic normality) - default. anscombe anscombe residuals – experimental anscombe2nd anscombe residuals Pierce Schafer (1986) based 2nd order approximation E(X)  – experimental pearsonNegBin compute Pearson residuals NegBin – experimental anscombeNegBin anscombe residuals NegBin – experimental none transformation  alpha parameter negative binomial distribution, s.t. variance \(m+\alpha *m^2\) reset logical: CUSUM statistic reset 0                 immediately alarm? traditional form                 chart used industrial process control,                 default choice outbreak detection                 continuous periods abnormal disease activity                 flagged.

text: sts surveillance::sts() format aggregated timeseries case counts control control object: range determines desired time points evaluated k reference value h decision boundary m determine expected number cases –                 following arguments possible numeric vector values                     length range. single numeric                     value specified value replicated                     length(range) times. NULL single value estimated                     taking mean observations previous                     first range value. "glm" GLM form $$\log(m_t)                       = \alpha + \beta t + \sum_{s=1}^S (\gamma_s                       \sin(\omega_s t) + \delta_s \cos(\omega_s t)),$$                     \(\omega_s = \frac{2\pi}{52}s\)                     Fourier frequencies fitted. model                     used predict range values. trans one following transformations (warning: Anscombe NegBin transformations experimental) rossi standardized variables z3 proposed Rossi standard standardized variables z1 (based              asymptotic normality) - default. anscombe anscombe residuals – experimental anscombe2nd anscombe residuals Pierce Schafer (1986) based 2nd order approximation E(X)  – experimental pearsonNegBin compute Pearson residuals NegBin – experimental anscombeNegBin anscombe residuals NegBin – experimental none transformation  alpha parameter negative binomial distribution, s.t. variance \(m+\alpha *m^2\) reset logical: CUSUM statistic reset 0                 immediately alarm? traditional form                 chart used industrial process control,                 default choice outbreak detection                 continuous periods abnormal disease activity                 flagged.  ... additional parameters passed onto wrap.algo

text: min_date Date object, minimum date time series used fitting model. max_date Date object, maximum date time series used fitting model. number_of_weeks Integer. Number weeks end time series reserved detection / monitoring therefore counted historic data model fitting. Default 6.

title: Determine Possible Outbreak Detection Methods Based on Available Historic Data — get_possible_methods
text: character vector possible algorithm names. Returns NULL   method applicable.

title: Determine Possible Outbreak Detection Methods Based on Available Historic Data — get_possible_methods
text: Historic data defined period min_date max_date - number_of_weeks. number available weeks computed interval, counting partial weeks full weeks match weekly aggregation used algorithms. method selection criteria approximately: 4 years (208 weeks) historic data available:         methods possible. 3 <4 years (156 <208 weeks) historic data         available: methods except "glm farrington"         "glm farrington timetrend" possible. 2 <3 years (104 <156 weeks) historic data         available: methods except "glm farrington",         "glm farrington timetrend"         "glm harmonic timetrend" possible. 26 <104 weeks historic data available:         "Mean", "CUSUM" "EARS" possible. 7 <26 weeks historic data available:         "Mean" "CUSUM" possible. 1 <7 weeks historic data available:         "CUSUM" possible. training data available (less 1 week),         NULL returned. function computes max_date_fit = max_date - number_of_weeks calculates number weeks min_date max_date_fit. Partial weeks counted full weeks align weekly aggregation data. Based number historic weeks, suitable algorithms selected using available_algorithms.

title: Get signals based on a weigthed GLM quasipoisson regression model for the expected case counts The GLM is flexible being able to just fit a mean, add a time trend, fit a harmonic sin/cos model or the seasons from the farringtonflexible. — get_signals_glm
code: get_signals_glm(   data_aggregated,   number_of_weeks = 6,   model = "mean",   time_trend = TRUE,   return_full_model = TRUE,   alpha_upper = 0.05,   intervention_date = NULL,   min_timepoints_baseline = 12,   min_timepoints_trend = 12,   past_weeks_not_included = 4 )

title: Get signals based on a weigthed GLM quasipoisson regression model for the expected case counts The GLM is flexible being able to just fit a mean, add a time trend, fit a harmonic sin/cos model or the seasons from the farringtonflexible. — get_signals_glm
text: data_aggregated data.frame, aggregated data case counts. number_of_weeks integer, specifying number weeks generate signals . model character, default "mean" one c("mean", "sincos", "FN") specifying kind model glm fitting. "mean" fits intercept model, "sincos" harmonic sincos model, "FN" uses seasgroups farrington fit parameters seasonality. time_trend boolean, default TRUE, TRUE timetrend fitted glm describing expected number cases. return_full_model boolean, default TRUE, specifying whether fitted values model obtained fitting model first week number_of_weeks returned attached data_aggregated well. alpha_upper decimal 0 1, default 0.05 specifying pvalue cutoff used computing threshold, set 0.05 95 percent quantile used. intervention_date date object character format yyyy-mm-dd NULL specifying date intervention pandemic correction models. Default NULL indicates intervention done, .e. additional intercept possibly new time trend fitted. date given new intercept possibly time_trend (time_trend == TRUE) fitted. min_timepoints_baseline integer, default 12, parameter used intervention_date NULL, specifying number weeks least needed fitting new baseline intervention. min_timepoints_trend integer, default 12, parameter used intervention_date NULL, specifying number weeks least needed fitting new timetrend intervention. past_weeks_not_included integer specifying number past weeks exclude fitting process. can useful excluding recent data outbreaks data may fully reported. Default `4`.

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: path_to_yaml character string specifying file path .yml configuration file user's computer. external .yml file used, set parameter NULL. config_set character string specifying name configuration read .yml file. onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.

title: Renders signal detection report — run_report
text: function supports generation single-pathogen multi-pathogen report `report_format = "HTML"`. Word (DOCX) output, single-pathogen reports currently supported.

title: Renders signal detection report — run_report
code: run_report(   data,   report_format = "HTML",   method = "FarringtonFlexible",   number_of_weeks = 6,   pathogens = NULL,   strata = c("county", "age_group"),   tables = TRUE,   output_file = NULL,   output_dir = ".",   signals_padded = NULL,   signals_agg = NULL,   intervention_date = NULL,   custom_logo = NULL,   custom_theme = NULL,   min_cases_signals = 1,   title = NULL )

title: Renders signal detection report — run_report
text: data data.frame containing surveillance data linelist format following format specified `input_metadata` report_format character, format report: "HTML" "DOCX" method character string, signal detection method used. One "FarringtonFlexible", "EARS" , "CUSUM", "Mean", "Timetrend", "Harmonic", "Harmonic timetrend", "Step harmonic", "Step harmonic timetrend". can retrieve full list using [names(available_algorithms())]. number_of_weeks integer, number weeks signals generated pathogens character vector specifying pathogens include report. `NULL` (default), pathogens present `data`, `signals_padded`, `signals_agg` used. Multi-pathogen reports supported HTML output. strata character vector specifying columns stratify. `NULL` strata used. precomputed signals provided  argument ignored strata inferred provided signals. Defaults c("county", "age_group") precomputed signals provided. tables Logical, default TRUE. True Signal Detection Tables included report. used DOCX reports, parameter ignored HTML reports. output_file character string specifying name output file (without directory path). `NULL` (default), file name automatically generated SignalDetectionReport. See render details. output_dir character string specifying output directory rendered output file (default ".", means rendered file saved current working directory. See render details. `NULL` used running report shiny app take Downloads folder default option saving. signals_padded tibble precomputed padded signals containing `pathogen` column. multiple pathogens present, tibble represent stacked together (e.g., using `dplyr::bind_rows()`). Defaults `NULL`, case signal data computed linelist within `run_report()` function. `NULL`, provided `signals_padded` used -, signals recomputed. signals_agg tibble aggregated signals containing `pathogen` column. multiple pathogens included, tibble represent stacked together (e.g., using `dplyr::bind_rows()`). Defaults `NULL`, case aggregated signals computed linelist within `run_report()` function. `NULL`, provided `signals_agg` used directly signals recomputed. intervention_date date object character format yyyy-mm-dd NULL specifying date intervention. can used interrupted timeseries analysis. works following methods: "Mean", "Timetrend", "Harmonic", "Harmonic timetrend", "Step harmonic", "Step harmonic timetrend". Default NULL indicates intervention done. custom_logo character string path png svg logo, replace default United4Surveillance logo. used `report_format` `"HTML"`. custom_theme bslib::bs_theme() replace default United4Surveillance theme. mainly used change colors. See bslib documentation parameters. Use version = "3" keep navbar intact. used `report_format` `"HTML"`. min_cases_signals integer, minimum number cases signal must . signals case counts smaller filtered post-processing step title NULL character string. Specifies title report created

text: Added signal post processing option filter signals specified minimum number cases Change highlighting signals map red border stars Map shows regions according NUTS level, independently number cases Changed internal structure HTML report individual rmds rendered strata HTML Report divided several pages reduce size improve loading time. report pages returned zip File adapted color scheme landing page highlight signals changed order length landing page pathogens user can provide report title via app yaml Added check column names provided shapefile Added shapefile_metadata.md description required shapefile format vectorizing internal functions preprocess_data() age_groups() speed make optional show historic threshold expectation FarringtonFlexible historic threshold shown FarringtonFlexible unnecessary recomputation signal weeks performed GLM based methods recompute model week signal detection period, just fit historic data never include weeks signal detection period Creating general get_possible_methods() function checks algorithms possible based available number weeks historic data. Removed fitting non glm methods data verify can applied. cases available signal detection period algorithm applied Restrict maximum number weeks signal detection 12 weeks functions add_missing_isoweeks(), find_age_group() get_possible_glm_methods() deleted. Added function add_cw_iso() adds column iso week-year used aggregation aggregate_data() modified can take grouping variable thus looping levels strata get_signals_stratified() removed replace dependency surveillance package computation seasgroups create_fn_data() computation fixed incorrect display warning message “Notice: input date_end smaller greatest date dataset.” fixed incorrect display week plot_time_series(interactive = T) (#401)

Exports 3 functions use outside Shiny app. Fixed legend bug time series plot switched plotly. Relaxed requirements map visualisation: map now shown even regions match shapefile.
